data.title: Tkinter: AttributeError: NoneType object has no attribute <attribute name>
data.content:
<p>I've created this simple GUI:</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> tkinter <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> *

root = Tk()

<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">grabText</span>(<span class="hljs-params">event</span>):
    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(entryBox.get())    

entryBox = Entry(root, width=<span class="hljs-number">60</span>).grid(row=<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, column=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, sticky=W)

grabBtn = Button(root, text=<span class="hljs-string">"Grab"</span>)
grabBtn.grid(row=<span class="hljs-number">8</span>, column=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)
grabBtn.bind(<span class="hljs-string">'&lt;Button-1&gt;'</span>, grabText)

root.mainloop()
</code></pre>

<p>I get the UI up and running. When I click on the <code>Grab</code> button, I get the following error on the console:</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python">C:\Python&gt; python.exe myFiles\testBed.py
Exception <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> Tkinter callback
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File <span class="hljs-string">"C:\Python\lib\lib-tk\Tkinter.py"</span>, line <span class="hljs-number">1403</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> __call__
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> self.func(*args)
  File <span class="hljs-string">"myFiles\testBed.py"</span>, line <span class="hljs-number">10</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> grabText
    <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> entryBox.get().strip()==<span class="hljs-string">""</span>:
AttributeError: <span class="hljs-string">'NoneType'</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">object</span> has no attribute <span class="hljs-string">'get'</span>
</code></pre>

<p>Why is <code>entryBox</code> set to <code>None</code>?</p>
